content: [on the structure of the text CIN, a polylogue reading, tension btwn writing and speech] “vibration of grammar in the voice” destined for the eye, or the interior voice, absolutely low voice
linkedContent: [on the structure of the text CIN, a polylogue reading, tension btwn writing and speech] “vibration of grammar in the voice” destined for the eye, or the interior voice, absolutely low voice

content: [on structure of CIN] graphic space opened to multiple readings—in traditional, protected form of book
linkedContent: [on structure of CIN] graphic space opened to multiple readings—in traditional, protected form of book

content: each time it gives a different reading, another gift, dealing out a new hand (nouvelle donne) all over again
linkedContent: each time it gives a different reading, another gift, dealing out a new hand (nouvelle donne) all over again

content: a voice does not betray a text: if it did, it would in the sense that betrayal is a revelation
linkedContent: a voice does not betray a text: if it did, it would in the sense that betrayal is a revelation

content: [re: taped readings of CIN] two voices yield to “another voice,” voice of signatory of text is figure of only one among others, not clear if this figure is masculine or woman
linkedContent: [re: taped readings of CIN] two voices yield to “another voice,” voice of signatory of text is figure of only one among others, not clear if this figure is masculine or woman

content: a desire, order, prayer or promise: “another voice, may it come soon now, again, another voice…”
linkedContent: a desire, order, prayer or promise: “another voice, may it come soon now, again, another voice…”

content: the cinder is no longer here, was (fut) it ever? [note relation btwn fire (feu) and cinders]
linkedContent: the cinder is no longer here, was (fut) it ever? [note relation btwn fire (feu) and cinders]

content: every cinder destined to decompose from w/in, a metaphor or metonymy of itself
linkedContent: every cinder destined to decompose from w/in, a metaphor or metonymy of itself

content: “il y la (là) cendres” [cf. POO p. 24 il y a là du secret], “there are cinders there, cinders there are” > losing equilibrium btwn eye & ear
linkedContent: “il y la (là) cendres” [cf. POO p. 24 il y a là du secret], “there are cinders there, cinders there are” > losing equilibrium btwn eye & ear

content: Derrida gives Cinder a proper name, is she the signatory of this text? [cf. KH p. 111]
linkedContent: Derrida gives Cinder a proper name, is she the signatory of this text? [cf. KH p. 111]

content: cinders: ce qui garde pour ne plus même garder, dooming (vouant) remnant (le reste) to dissolution

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

linkedContent: cinders: ce qui garde pour ne plus même garder, dooming (vouant) remnant (le reste) to dissolution

content: verb “incinerate” has none of the tenderness, patience of cinder, Derrida doesn’t like it
linkedContent: verb “incinerate” has none of the tenderness, patience of cinder, Derrida doesn’t like it

content: cinder: doesn’t say what it is, but what it was (fut), remains in memory of departed (feu), all our lost etymologies, fatum, fuit, functus, defunctus
linkedContent: cinder: doesn’t say what it is, but what it was (fut), remains in memory of departed (feu), all our lost etymologies, fatum, fuit, functus, defunctus

content: “se donnant à elle-même, se donnant comme son propre nom, l’art consumé du secret: de l’exhibition savoir se garder” [to give to itself, give to itself as its proper name, consummate art of secret: the exhibition of knowing how to guard oneself] [compare to God’s fiery consumption]

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: “l’incinéré n’est plus rien fors la cendre [innermost cinder furnace], un reste qui se doit de ne plus rester, ce lieu de rien qui soit, un lieu pur se chiffrât-il [marked out]” > there are cinders, what takes place in letting a place occur
linkedContent: “l’incinéré n’est plus rien fors la cendre [innermost cinder furnace], un reste qui se doit de ne plus rester, ce lieu de rien qui soit, un lieu pur se chiffrât-il [marked out]” > there are cinders, what takes place in letting a place occur

content: no cinder w/out fire, that is what is owed (se doit) to fire, [yet, if possible] w/out shadow of sacrifice, at noon, w/out debt, w/out Phoenix, au lieu d’aucun placement, place solely of incineration

motif.title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

linkedContent: no cinder w/out fire, that is what is owed (se doit) to fire, [yet, if possible] w/out shadow of sacrifice, at noon, w/out debt, w/out Phoenix, au lieu d’aucun placement, place solely of incineration

content: cinder remains, cinder there is, nonbeing, nonpresence
linkedContent: cinder remains, cinder there is, nonbeing, nonpresence

content: nothing will have taken place but the place, there are cinders, there is place (il y a lieu) > this untranslatable, like a hidden proper name, carries everything away toward prescribed limit, recognition, debt, obligation > place (proper name) for giving, rendering, celebrating, loving, friendship, dissemination…
linkedContent: nothing will have taken place but the place, there are cinders, there is place (il y a lieu) > this untranslatable, like a hidden proper name, carries everything away toward prescribed limit, recognition, debt, obligation > place (proper name) for giving, rendering, celebrating, loving, friendship, dissemination…

content: dissemination expresses in “il y a là cendre” what is destined by the fire to dispersion w/out return, pyrificiation of what doesn’t remain, and returns to no one
linkedContent: dissemination expresses in “il y a là cendre” what is destined by the fire to dispersion w/out return, pyrificiation of what doesn’t remain, and returns to no one

content: there are cinders only if there is a hearth, some fire or place, cinder as the house of being
linkedContent: there are cinders only if there is a hearth, some fire or place, cinder as the house of being

content: why the phrase “il y a là cendre” doesn’t belong to him [Derrida] > cinder lent, given, to so many others, cinder remains virginal (the only thing he loves), in tact (intacte), the sentence doesn’t even say the cinder
linkedContent: why the phrase “il y a là cendre” doesn’t belong to him [Derrida] > cinder lent, given, to so many others, cinder remains virginal (the only thing he loves), in tact (intacte), the sentence doesn’t even say the cinder

content: pure burning light: no sign of passage, pure consuming destruction, noon w/out contrary (Lichtgüsse)
linkedContent: pure burning light: no sign of passage, pure consuming destruction, noon w/out contrary (Lichtgüsse)

content: holocaust as gift before every determinable being [see CIN in FIRE]
linkedContent: holocaust as gift before every determinable being [see CIN in FIRE]

content: [see FIRE for what’s lost, what begins, in guarding]

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

linkedContent: [see FIRE for what’s lost, what begins, in guarding]

content: best paradigm for trace not the trail of the hunt, le frayage, wake in sea, nor love of step (pas) for its imprint, but the cinder (what remains w/out remaining from holocaust, from the all-burning [du brûle-tout]) > no longer makes a trace, or traces only by losing trace qu’elle reste à peine ——cinder gets lost down to cinder of its cinder, he burns one more time, he burns what he still adores although he already burned it, he’s intent on it (il s’y acharne)

motif.title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

content: the origin of history: pure difference ceases to be what it is to remain what it is, the going down (déclin), setting sun, passage to occidental history
linkedContent: the origin of history: pure difference ceases to be what it is to remain what it is, the going down (déclin), setting sun, passage to occidental history

content: [question of the bridge asked 3x] 1) how from this consuming destruction w/out limit can something remain that primes dialectical process and opens history? 2) how could the purest of the pure, the worst of the worst, l’incendie panique du brûle-tout, put forth some monument, i.e. pyramis 3) if all-burning destroys its letter, its body, how can it guard the trace of itself and breach/broach (entamer) a history where it preserves (se conserve) itself in losing itself? [see CIN pp. 24-30 in FIRE for fuller explanation]
linkedContent: [question of the bridge asked 3x] 1) how from this consuming destruction w/out limit can something remain that primes dialectical process and opens history? 2) how could the purest of the pure, the worst of the worst, l’incendie panique du brûle-tout, put forth some monument, i.e. pyramis 3) if all-burning destroys its letter, its body, how can it guard the trace of itself and breach/broach (entamer) a history where it preserves (se conserve) itself in losing itself? [see CIN pp. 24-30 in FIRE for fuller explanation]

content: pure difference of absolute accident, play and pure difference, secret of imperceptible all-burning, does not even relate to its own conflagration, is nothing
linkedContent: pure difference of absolute accident, play and pure difference, secret of imperceptible all-burning, does not even relate to its own conflagration, is nothing

content: (ici s’éprouve la force implacable du sens, of mediation, of the negative) all-burning must pass into its contrary, guard itself: as soon as fire shows itself: il reste, il se retient, it loses itself as fire
linkedContent: (ici s’éprouve la force implacable du sens, of mediation, of the negative) all-burning must pass into its contrary, guard itself: as soon as fire shows itself: il reste, il se retient, it loses itself as fire

content: chance of substance as a sacrifice [?], the all-burning sacrifices itself as all-burning, erection of the pyramid guards life (the dead)—“Opfer,” even but better “holocaust,” burns all (caustos holos), even burns fire, holocaust contains seeds of ontology [re: Hegel]
linkedContent: chance of substance as a sacrifice [?], the all-burning sacrifices itself as all-burning, erection of the pyramid guards life (the dead)—“Opfer,” even but better “holocaust,” burns all (caustos holos), even burns fire, holocaust contains seeds of ontology [re: Hegel]

content: this holocaust as the gift, before (if one could count time) ontology, w/out which the dialectical movement & history of Being couldn’t open, no engaging annulus of anniversary, no annulment in solar course from Orient to Occident
linkedContent: this holocaust as the gift, before (if one could count time) ontology, w/out which the dialectical movement & history of Being couldn’t open, no engaging annulus of anniversary, no annulment in solar course from Orient to Occident

content: gift & holocaust, before exchange, are not, but as soon as it burns, it burns its very act of burning and begins to be > the speculative, dialectic: the reflection (speculum) of holocaust’s holocaust, the blaze cooled by glass, ice mirror
linkedContent: gift & holocaust, before exchange, are not, but as soon as it burns, it burns its very act of burning and begins to be > the speculative, dialectic: the reflection (speculum) of holocaust’s holocaust, the blaze cooled by glass, ice mirror

content: the gift can only be a sacrifice: that is the axiom of speculative reason > it must become philosophy, religion’s truth
linkedContent: the gift can only be a sacrifice: that is the axiom of speculative reason > it must become philosophy, religion’s truth

content: name “cinder” a cinder of the cinder itself
linkedContent: name “cinder” a cinder of the cinder itself

content: btwn black & white, color of writing resembles only “literality” of cinder that still inheres in a language
linkedContent: btwn black & white, color of writing resembles only “literality” of cinder that still inheres in a language

content: perhaps he [Derrida] (or she [la cinder]) knew what he set on fire, what he praised in the secret of the sentence “il y a là cendre,” but he may discover more in its unconscious, and he will die > then the phrase w/ its chance of surviving him will be more cinder than ever, and less—w/out anyone to say “I”
linkedContent: perhaps he [Derrida] (or she [la cinder]) knew what he set on fire, what he praised in the secret of the sentence “il y a là cendre,” but he may discover more in its unconscious, and he will die > then the phrase w/ its chance of surviving him will be more cinder than ever, and less—w/out anyone to say “I”

content: [Derrida on his own “counterfeiter’s forgery,” on his ability to lie, or not be certain what he knows, but what does he know or lie about w/ such indeterminate phrases?]
linkedContent: [Derrida on his own “counterfeiter’s forgery,” on his ability to lie, or not be certain what he knows, but what does he know or lie about w/ such indeterminate phrases?]

content: entrust words to a page: better to inflame you, eat yourself up immediately, not a tomb that offers patience of mourning, but a tomb of a tomb, deprived of patience of mourning
linkedContent: entrust words to a page: better to inflame you, eat yourself up immediately, not a tomb that offers patience of mourning, but a tomb of a tomb, deprived of patience of mourning

content: incineration celebrates perhaps the nothing of the all, destruction w/out return, mad w/ its desire, desperate disseminal affirmation but also its opposite: “no” to the work mourning, “no” of fire > how to accept working for his Highness (monseigneur) mourning?
linkedContent: incineration celebrates perhaps the nothing of the all, destruction w/out return, mad w/ its desire, desperate disseminal affirmation but also its opposite: “no” to the work mourning, “no” of fire > how to accept working for his Highness (monseigneur) mourning?

content: the chance of returning, when one “incenses” a sentence to infinity, adorned w/ all its dead, is more certain than securing sentence in an archive [fire guards better than archive]
linkedContent: the chance of returning, when one “incenses” a sentence to infinity, adorned w/ all its dead, is more certain than securing sentence in an archive [fire guards better than archive]

content: if you no longer recall it, it’s because the incineration/consummation of cinder proceeds from cinder itself > trace destined like everything to disappear so as to lose its way or rekindle a memory
linkedContent: if you no longer recall it, it’s because the incineration/consummation of cinder proceeds from cinder itself > trace destined like everything to disappear so as to lose its way or rekindle a memory

content: Plato murmuring in enclosure of pharmacy, a perfumed murmur
linkedContent: Plato murmuring in enclosure of pharmacy, a perfumed murmur

content: [“Ah no, above all not”] Phoenix, the mark, in my fundamental language
linkedContent: [“Ah no, above all not”] Phoenix, the mark, in my fundamental language

content: plurality of cinders, innumerable lurks (couvait) beneath the cinder
linkedContent: plurality of cinders, innumerable lurks (couvait) beneath the cinder

content: rebellion against Phoenix, affirmation of fire w/out place or mourning
linkedContent: rebellion against Phoenix, affirmation of fire w/out place or mourning

content: you only have mass or volume when covered w/ cinders, like covering one’s head w/ ashes in sign of mourning
linkedContent: you only have mass or volume when covered w/ cinders, like covering one’s head w/ ashes in sign of mourning

content: nothing out of reach of the tongue of fire (langue de feu), not even cinders if there are cinders there, save a chance (fors une chance)
linkedContent: nothing out of reach of the tongue of fire (langue de feu), not even cinders if there are cinders there, save a chance (fors une chance)

content: the totally incinerated envois could not be indicated by any mark
linkedContent: the totally incinerated envois could not be indicated by any mark

content: essence of cinder (its cinder itself): the insistent pharmakon of a plural body (doesn’t belong to itself) in which the retreat of fire disguises itself > if there is cinder, fire remains in retreat
linkedContent: essence of cinder (its cinder itself): the insistent pharmakon of a plural body (doesn’t belong to itself) in which the retreat of fire disguises itself > if there is cinder, fire remains in retreat

content: no Phoenix, no monument, aucune érection qui tienne—ou tombe, the cinder w/out ascension, the cinders love me [cf. “proximity loves me” from PC], “they change sex, they re-cinder themselves, they androgynocide themselves”
linkedContent: no Phoenix, no monument, aucune érection qui tienne—ou tombe, the cinder w/out ascension, the cinders love me [cf. “proximity loves me” from PC], “they change sex, they re-cinder themselves, they androgynocide themselves”

content: “give fire its due, light counterfires in order to stop the progression of a blaze, avoid a holocaust” > fire’s share (part) is impossible to delimit (by virtue of the lexicon, the ‘themes’)
linkedContent: “give fire its due, light counterfires in order to stop the progression of a blaze, avoid a holocaust” > fire’s share (part) is impossible to delimit (by virtue of the lexicon, the ‘themes’)

content: “language poisons for us the most secret of our secrets…one must even sacrifice one’s own sacrifice to it”
linkedContent: “language poisons for us the most secret of our secrets…one must even sacrifice one’s own sacrifice to it”

content: Woolf: “incarnadine the willows…for we have done with this ‘education’!”
linkedContent: Woolf: “incarnadine the willows…for we have done with this ‘education’!”

content: cinder comes in place of the gift
linkedContent: cinder comes in place of the gift

content: the cinder like burning semen (semence brûlante), lava destined nowhere, when you take word into your mouth, to breathe
linkedContent: the cinder like burning semen (semence brûlante), lava destined nowhere, when you take word into your mouth, to breathe

content: cinder obviously a figure, but because word “cinder,” via the name, is supposed to name the thing (not the word), it names one thing in place of another, metonymy when cinder is separated, names one thing while figuring another from which il ne rest rien de figurable en elle
linkedContent: cinder obviously a figure, but because word “cinder,” via the name, is supposed to name the thing (not the word), it names one thing in place of another, metonymy when cinder is separated, names one thing while figuring another from which il ne rest rien de figurable en elle

content: cinder & smoke (fumée): smoke gets lost w/out perceptible remainder, spirited away, sublimates; cinder falls (tombe), lets go, heavy, more material because it fritters away its word: it is very divisible ——cinder, nothing that can be in the world, remains beyond everything that is (konis epekeina tēs ousias), giving itself (es gibt ashes)—it’s nothing
linkedContent: cinder & smoke (fumée): smoke gets lost w/out perceptible remainder, spirited away, sublimates; cinder falls (tombe), lets go, heavy, more material because it fritters away its word: it is very divisible ——cinder, nothing that can be in the world, remains beyond everything that is (konis epekeina tēs ousias), giving itself (es gibt ashes)—it’s nothing

content: cendre, cenere, ashes, cinis, Asche, cendrier (a whole sentence), Aschenbecher, ashtray, cineres, ceniza ——cinder, nothing that can be in the world, remains beyond everything that is (konis epekeina tēs ousias), giving itself (es gibt ashes)—it’s nothing

content: and you can also receive semen through the ear
linkedContent: and you can also receive semen through the ear

content: [quoting from PC] Derrida telling “you” [his love?] to eat all his ashes, to approach him by slowly advancing toward death, an absolute reconciliation
linkedContent: [quoting from PC] Derrida telling “you” [his love?] to eat all his ashes, to approach him by slowly advancing toward death, an absolute reconciliation

content: Derrida’s not accumulating surplus value, speculating on some cinder capital, but making a withdrawal (retrait), to try his luck on a gift w/out the least memory of itself, un retrait (retreat, retracing) w/ no relation to what he just did, what he’s about to tell you

motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
